channel.title: DevOps on Xianpeng Shen
channel.description: Recent content in DevOps on Xianpeng Shen
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2017–2025 Xianpeng Shen. All rights reserved.

item.title: Tired of Jenkinsfile Errors Only After Committing—Try This Pre-check Tool!
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: A magical local Jenkinsfile checker, uses API validation, perfectly supports pre-commit.

item.title: Commit Check v2.0.0 Released—TOML Config Support, Simplified CLI & Hooks, Rebuilt Validation Engine!
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: After a month of intermittent development and testing, I have finally completed this major update. This is the biggest update Commit Check has received since its inception.

item.title: DevOps Maturity — From Reflection to Open Source Practice
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: How to assess and improve your team’s DevOps maturity. Official release of the DevOps Maturity open source project, with assessment tools and practical guides.

item.title: How to Change abortPrevious Value in Jenkins?
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: In Jenkins, the disableConcurrentBuilds option is used to manage concurrent builds. This article explains how to conditionally set the abortPrevious value based on the branch being built, allowing for more flexible build management.

item.title: CI/CD—Not a One-Time Project, but a Continuously Evolving System
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: In DevOps, CI/CD pipelines require continuous maintenance and refactoring. This article explores why CI/CD is not a one-time construction project, but a system that requires long-term investment and continuous evolution.

item.title: What Optimizations I Made During the Jenkins Upgrade
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article discusses the optimizations made during the Jenkins upgrade, including using Docker Compose for deployment, refactoring the Jenkins Shared Library, introducing Windows Docker Containers, and more to enhance the efficiency and security of the CI/CD process.

item.title: How to Automatically Categorize GitHub Release Notes by New features, Bug Fixes…
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article shares two methods for automatically categorizing the content of GitHub Release Notes based on titles.

item.title: How to fix "hidden symbol `__gcov_init' in ../libgcov.a(_gcov.o) is referenced by DSO"
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to resolve the “hidden symbol `__gcov_init’ in ../libgcov.a(_gcov.o) is referenced by DSO” error when building a project with Gcov, including how to ensure symbols are not hidden.

item.title: About Code Coverage
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article briefly introduces the concept, importance, common metrics, working principle, and mainstream tools of code coverage, emphasizing that code coverage metrics should not be over-relied upon.

item.title: How to backup Jenkins
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to backup Jenkins using the ThinBackup plugin and shell scripts, ensuring that your Jenkins configuration and build data are safely stored.

item.title: Jenkins Top 3 best practice
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Discusses three best practices for Jenkins: Configuration as Code, Shared Libraries, and Multi-Branch Pipeline, highlighting their benefits in terms of transparency, traceability, and self-service builds.

item.title: Beijing 48 Hours — A DevOps Training Camp Experience
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: A record of my experience attending the JFrog DevOps training camp in Beijing, sharing training content, personal feelings, and reflections on future work.

item.title: A Code Coverage Tool - Squish Coco use examples
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: introduction to Squish Coco, a code coverage tool, with examples of how to set it up and use it in Visual Studio for C++ projects.
